name: Basin Harbor Club

reviews.text: My husband and I travel quite a bit and have had the opportunity to stay at a range of hotels, resorts and B&B's. For the most part, we have very reasonable expectations according to the price of a room at any given property. After recently staying at the Basin Harbor Club, we were completely disappointed by the quality of the "club" let alone the price we were paying for the room ($200 a night).

reviews.text: We had a great time and are looking forward to September when we can go back again

Found out about the Basin Harbor Club through Travel Zoo . The deal included breakfast, unlimited golf, and a 20% off coupon for dinner at the resort. We (my husband and I) stayed Sunday Sept. 2nd and left on the 3rd, which was Labor Day weekend - surprised this wasn't blacked out for the deal. We golfed a round of 18 holes on Sunday afternoon and again Monday morning before we left. The golf course was probably a 3 on a scale of 1 - 5.The grounds were really nice; felt like I had stepped back in time to the 1950s. The resort consists of an inn and cottages. We stayed in the Inn. Our room, Room #24, had a beautiful view of the harbor. It reminded me of a B & B room - nicely decorated, big, comfy bed,lots of closet space and hangers, good AC, and huge soft towels. Two negatives - no fan in bathroom and no full size mirror. The room was a bit outdated but that's part of the ambience.Right outside our room, you could go out on a balcony which again overlooked the harbor. There happened to be a wedding reception right out side our room Sunday afternoon - kind of fun looking at all the guests. Another negative about the inn was there were no ice machines; you had to go down to the lobby and it took forever to get ice.The lobby and sitting areas throughout the inn were neat. lots of historic pictures of the resort and antique furniture. We were also invited to a welcome reception Sunday evening where wine and hors-doevres were served for about an hour. We enjoyed walking around the grounds and also found a path that goes around the lake a little ways. Enjoyed a beautiful sunset - very romantic.
reviews.title: Depends what you are looking for …
Don't miss this unique opportunity to relax with your family & pets.
reviews.text: We had a fantastic July 4th holiday at Basin Harbor. They presented an incredible fireworks display and had lots of fun activites - such as mimosa's on the waterfront for adults & a kid's bike parade that was utterly charming.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is truly pet-friendly. They managed to achieve a nice balance - guests were respectful of pet rules on clean-up/barking/control and we didn't feel overly burdened with rules or like we were missing out on the property. Our two dogs had a great time lounging on the cottage deck watching boats and running the edgewater trail.
reviews.title: Very romantic at the start of the season

reviews.text: The cottages are quaint and very individual - our original cottage didn't have a deck or porch like we had in mind so the concierge helped us find one more suitable.
reviews.title: I lucked out

reviews.text: The food was very good and there were many alternatives to choose from.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay at Basin Harbor
I love Basin Harbor Club on Lake Champlain
reviews.text: We stayed at the Basin Harbor Club merely because it is listed in the Historic Hotels book. Little did we know how great it really is. We stayed about a month ago and it had just opened two days before. We seemed to have the place to ourselves. It was very romantic. Also, we booked online and thought that we’d get a room in the inn (historic hotel and all) but we were surprised to see that most of the accommodations are cottages. Sweet little cottages. Very clean cottages and ours had a huge bathroom with a whirlpool tub. We loved the place entirely. The breakfast was exquisite. We had dinner at the Red Mill because the main dining room wasn’t open yet. It was fine. The grounds are gorgeous and will be truly beautiful in about July and August. We did not have the children with us but there seems to be a great arrangement for the kids with a camp area and dinner with the rest of the kids so the parents can eat in peace. Highly recommend the Basin Harbor Club.

reviews.title: great for young families
reviews.text: our family consisting of grandparents, parents and young children had our annual vacation here. the owners are always around which gives all an air of caring. the food was certainly adequate. it was fresh and plentiful, but not gourmet. breakfast and lunch buffets were better than dinners. we didn't expect luxury, and the accommodations were fine. the place, on the whole could use a coat of paint and a scrub brush on all the doors and windows of the cabins. there was an empty bowl on our porch for our entire visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: saying all that, the kids had the best time imaginable. activities were plentiful. wish they didn't charge for all guided adult walks, and use of tennis courts, however. charge a few extra bucks, and include more activities for the adults.
reviews.title: What a find - will definitely return

likes.liked: — Family run resort that cares about the guests

reviews.text: Primarily a family resort on the lake, however, just my wife and I stayed for 2 nights and loved the place. We will return with our family next time! We stayed in a building that was built around 1800 - they have many different buildings on the property, plus cabins - some that overlook the lake. The resort has a golf course, large heated pool, numerous children activities, boating, and excellent food. We did not eat dinner in the formal dinning room, but ate at the Red Mill on the property. This is family type dinning, however, the food was very good. The highlight of our trip was the "shore" lobster dinner. They set up a large tent next to the lake, plus tables near the lake, for a wonderful dinner. The property has beautiful flower gardens, which my wife enjoyed on a flower tour. The evenings end early, with no TV or radios in your room, however, their was a TV in a common room.
reviews.title: Relaxing but strange!

likes.disliked: — The formality at dinner and the additional costs for activities.

reviews.text: I note that the previous reviewers are all from America so I thought I'd give a UK perspective. We booked through Virgin Atlantic and loved the idea of the rural location and activities however we were not warned about the formality of the main dining room. We never take formal clothing on holiday and boys aged 10 upwards are required to wear a jacket and tie. Whilst the staff offered to loan some jackets and ties they would not have gone with the jeans and shorts. As we were not offered any dining plan the meal at $44 plus tax and 18% inforced gratuity didn't represent value for money. The Redmill restaurant was more casual however we found the standard of food very much depended on what you ordered. My meal of fish and chips was appalling and had to be sent back but the staff dealt with the situation compassionately and efficiently.
reviews.title: Great famiy vacation, could use some refinement

likes.liked: — Great breakfasts and lunches; friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Dinners in Main dining room; spotty housekeeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also found the resort focused mainly on golf and tennis and there were additional costs for all activities. If we had been made aware of what the Basin Harbor offered we definately would not have booked it. Saying that the location and views are wonderful and it is very peaceful and totally relaxing. We stayed in an historic room which was well furnished with all the facilities we needed however the shower room reminded me of being in a caravan, it was desperately in need of renovation. Please don't be put off by my review we had a nice couple of days and our view wasn't representative of the many families who return year after. The guest book was full of high praise from guests on their 10th visit. There were lots of large family groups which included three generations.
reviews.title: I love this place!

description: Basin Harbor Club is a 700 acre resort on the shores of Lake Champlain. Owned and operated by 4th generation innkeepers, we have over 125 years of exceptional guest service. Open for three seasons, Basin Harbor offers a peaceful retreat for anyone who enjoys the outdoors, unparalleled service and a dedication to excellent food, integrating Addison County's over 200 farmers and producers. Basin Harbor's diverse offerings accommodate family vacations, destination weddings, golf outings and corporate retreats. Our recreational menu include an 18 hole golf course with practice facilities, tennis courts, badminton, croquet, water skiing, boat rentals, kayaks, sailboats and power boat rentals. Our renowned Kids Camp offers comprehensive programming for ages 3-17. Visit Vermont's finest lakeside resort and hotel.
